message_1:

message_2:
To decrypt the message "XVTJY" using the Vigenere cipher with the keyword "MATH", we will reverse the encryption process. We will use the keyword letters to find the corresponding row in the table and then find the column that matches the encrypted letter. The letter at the top of that column is the decrypted letter.

1. The first letter of the keyword is "M". In the "M" row, find the column with the letter "X" (the first letter of the encrypted message). The letter at the top of that column is "S".

2. The second letter of the keyword is "A". In the "A" row, find the column with the letter "V" (the second letter of the encrypted message). The letter at the top of that column is "V".

3. The third letter of the keyword is "T". In the "T" row, find the column with the letter "T" (the third letter of the encrypted message). The letter at the top of that column is "E".

4. The fourth letter of the keyword is "H". In the "H" row, find the column with the letter "J" (the fourth letter of the encrypted message). The letter at the top of that column is "C".

5. The keyword repeats, so we go back to the first letter "M". In the "M" row, find the column with the letter "Y" (the fifth letter of the encrypted message). The letter at the top of that column is "R".

So, the decrypted message is "SVECR".
